pageTitle: FINANCE HOUSE (FH:Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange): Stock Quote & Company Profile - Businessweek
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9260=Finance House P.J.S.C., Board Meeting, Apr 29, 2015. Agenda: To review and approve the interim condensed consolidated financial statements for the first quarter ended 31 March 2015., 8003=Finance House P.J.S.C. reported unaudited consolidated earnings results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2015. For the quarter, the company reported net profit fell 28% to AED 25.5 million in the first quarter to March compared to AED 35.5 million in the same period last year. Net interest income and income from Islamic financing and investing assets was AED 44.072 million compared to AED 29.860 million a year ago. Total operating income was AED 79.348 million compared to AED 91.204 million a year ago. Profit attributable to equity holders of the parent was AED 26.989 million or AED 0.09 per basic and diluted share compared to AED 32.468 million or AED 0.11 per basic and diluted share a year ago. Net cash used in operating activities was AED 2.568 million compared to AED 154.321 million a year ago. Purchase of properly, fixtures and equipment was AED 1.918 million compared to AED 7.139 million a year ago., 4789=Finance House P.J.S.C. provides investments, consumer and commercial financing, and other related services primarily in the United Arab Emirates. It operates through six segments: Commercial and Retail Financing, Investment, Islamic Financing and Investing, Insurance, Construction, and Brokerage. The Commercial and Retail Financing segment offers loans and other credit facilities for institutional and individual customers. The Investment segment is involved in the management of investment portfolio and treasury activities. The Islamic Financing and Investing segment provides investment, consumer and commercial financing, and other related services based on Islamic Sharia’s rules and principles. The Insurance segment offers non-life insurance products. The Construction segment engages in the real estate construction related activities. The Brokerage segment provides brokerage services. The company also offers executive, auto, home, commercial, and corporate finance products; financing solutions to SMEs; and credit cards, guarantees, and payroll distribution solutions, as well as flexi and fixed deposits. In addition, it is involved in the investment and development, asset management, and sukuk issuance activities; and provision of electromechanical contracting services. The company was founded in 2004 and is headquartered in Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates., 9809=Finance House P.J.S.C announced earnings results for the year ended December 31, 2014. For the year, the company reported total comprehensive income of AED 94.6 million.}
